intro: Dysoxylum spiciflorum, commonly known as the spiky-flowered dysoxylum, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces woody fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the biodiversity in its native habitats.
